Yes, advanced analytics and technology are already being used in many sports besides football, and I anticipate that this trend will continue to grow in the future. 

For example, in basketball, teams are using data analytics to identify and analyze player performance data in order to improve team strategies and individual player development. In baseball, teams have been using advanced statistics for years to evaluate players' past performance and predict future outcomes. In addition, sports like Tennis, Cricket, and Rugby have also started to use sophisticated data analysis techniques to improve performance.

With the advancement in the internet of things (IoT), machine learning, and artificial intelligence technologies, it will be easier for coaches and sports analysts to collect and analyze vast amounts of data in real-time, which can help them make more informed decisions and quickly identify areas for improvement. This will give sports teams a competitive edge and lead to better outcomes in the future.
